text:
Hi there! Could you please help!
I need get full contacts via API by range date, but I can`t use contact/search API because I have more then 10000 contacts per day.
Script will fired today for yesterday, but I don`t understand how can I fix this limit ((
Hi Team, How to get the overall count of contacts by parameters using HubSpot API?

Hello everyone!!
My company needs help to create an integration for deals information from HubSpot.
Today, we are integrating with the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals|endpoint> GET /crm/v3/objects/deals using as parameters: propertiesWithHistory and properties.
We need all historic and updated information from all properties in deals entity.
But, we are having difficult to create the incremental logic. :pensive:
For example, when we get information from the endpoint said before using propertiesWithHistory, we have a data structure like this: 'id','value','metric','sourceId','sourceType','timestamp','updatedByUserId'.
How can we create an incremental logic with the same data structure using deals endpoint? :thinking_face:
We need the same data structure because some fields like updatedByUserId are used in other process.
Is this possible? If not, what is the best way to create the incremental integration for deals information?

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.

Hi! I'm a Data Engineer and setting up an EL pipeline from our database to HubSpot. I haven't worked a lot with Oauth and was wondering if there's an real benefit to using `Oauth2` vs the `Private APP token` ?

It seems like there are potentially some security benefits for `Oauth2` since you are sending the `access token` for most requests and that token expires. Am I missing something? It's obviously just more work to set up an Oauth flow vs using a Private App token.
hey could use some help rate limiting custom code in a workflow. It quickly hits the secondly and 10 secondly limit, and not sure how to prevent this.
<@U04T2CUCP8T> have you tried catching the err for rate limit issue or looking at the headers of the response and adding in delays in your code?
delay is on all 3 API actions per contact

raised limit to 1000, still getting the following
```{"status":"error","message":"You have reached your secondly limit.","errorType":"RATE_LIMIT","correlationId":"1bf6c60a-b93e-4a95-9ac9-f96bcedccf34","policyName":"SECONDLY","groupName":"publicapi:crm:search:oauth:1512050:26892217"}```
<@U03REFNRMB3> any ideas? cant understand why it would give a secondly or 10 secondly limit hit with a 1.5 second delay between all calls
